comments: a(n) is divisible by 8. 2^(3+4k) divides a(4k) and a(4k+2). 8k divides a(4k-1). 4(4k+2) divides a(4k+1). - _Alexander Adamchuk_, Nov 18 2006
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=0,...,100
prog: (PARI) { for (n=0, 100, write("b060375.txt", n, " ", (n + 2)^(n + 3) - n^(n + 1)); ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 04 2009]
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Apr 02 2001
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Apr 20 2001
